page.title: 18Farming
page.content: The area around Catthorpe is divided between 5 farms,the largest of which surrounds the village and was built in 1882 as a model farm.All the farm buildings and out-houses are covered by the same preservation order as the village. The farm land (which is disected by the M1) is mainly arable covering 800 acres.A small plot of land was given by the farmer to a local unemployed villager who now has a growing horticultural business. The second largest farm is SSE of the village and was originally part of "Kelmarsh,which has been drained, providing grazing land for the farmers herd of cattle and pedigree flock of sheep. The remaining three farms grow crops and have herds of animals.
